@@ -61,0 +61,9 @@ + * @apiNote When {@code autoWaitForIdle()} is enabled, mouse and key related methods + * cannot be called on the AWT EDT. This is because when {@code autoWaitForIdle()} + * is enabled, the mouse and key methods implicitly call {@code waitForIdle()} + * which will throw {@code IllegalThreadStateException} when called on the AWT EDT. + * In addition, screen capture operations can be lengthy + * and {@code delay(long ms)} clearly inserts a delay, so these also + * should not be called on the EDT. Taken together, this means that as much as possible, + * methods on this class should not be called on the EDT. + *
